sen.j: 氷上 志計志麻呂（ひかみ の しけしまろ、生没年不詳）は奈良時代の皇族。
sen.e: HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family in the Nara period.
HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: date→year,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Nara period.
He was a great grand-child of Emperor Tenmu.
He was a great grand-child of the Emperor Tenmu.
He was a great grand-child of the Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 父は新田部親王の子塩焼王（氷上塩焼）、母は不破内親王。
sen.e: His parents were Prince Shioyaki, a son of Imperial Prince Niitabe, and Imperial Princess Fuwa.
His parents were the Prince Shioyaki (HIKAMI no Shioyaki), a son of the Imperial Prince Niitabe, and the Imperial Princess Fuwa.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。（氷上塩焼）を補いました。
sen.e: His parents were the Prince Shioyaki (HIKAMI no Shioyaki), a son of the Imperial Prince Niitabe, and the Imperial Princess Fuwa.

sen.j: 同母弟に氷上川継がいる。
sen.e: His maternal half-brother was HIKAMI no Kawatsugu.
His maternal half-brother was HIKAMI no Kawatsugu.
His maternal half-brother was HIKAMI no Kawatsugu.
(Some theories say that the two of them are the same person)
(Some theories say that the two are the same person)
sen.cmt: of them を削除しました。
sen.e: (Some theories say that the two are the same person)

sen.j: 父の塩焼王は臣籍降下して氷上真人姓を賜る。
sen.e: His father, Prince Shioyaki was demoted from nobility to subject and was granted Hikami no Mahito (the highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His father, the Prince Shioyaki was demoted from nobility to subject and was granted the name of Hikami no Mahito (the highest of the eight hereditary titles).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。name of を補いました。Hikami→HIKAMI と修正しました。(the highest of the eight hereditary titles) については関係がよく分かりません。
sen.e: His father, the Prince Shioyaki was demoted from nobility to subject and was granted the name of Hikami no Mahito (the highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）塩焼王は藤原仲麻呂の乱で偽帝に擁され処刑されたが、母の不破内親王と志計志麻呂は罰されなかった。
sen.e: Although Prince Shioyaki was executed since he had backed the imperial throne against FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war In 764, Shikeshimaro, his mother, Imperial Princess Fuwa weren't subject to punishment.

Although the Prince Shioyaki was executed due to that he was held as a false emperor in the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro in 764, Shikeshimaro, his mother, the Imperial Princess Fuwa were not punished.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。since→due to that,had backed the imperial throne against FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war→was held as a false emperor in the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro,In→in,weren't subject to punishment→were not punished と修正しました。
sen.e: Although the Prince Shioyaki was executed due to that he was held as a false emperor in the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro in 764, Shikeshimaro, his mother, the Imperial Princess Fuwa were not punished.

sen.j: 神護景雲3年（769年）5月、不破内親王は県犬養姉女、忍坂女王、石田女王ら女官と共に孝謙天皇称徳天皇を呪詛して命を縮め志計志麻呂を皇位につけようとする巫蠱の術を行ったとされた。
sen.e: It is said that Imperial Princess Fuwa performed an occult act (巫蠱の術) together with court ladies such as AGATA no Unukai no amane, Oshisaka no himemiko and Ishida no himemiko to curse Emperor Koken and Emperor Shotoku together to shorten their life in order to put Shikeshimaro on the Throne.

It is said that the Imperial Princess Fuwa performed an occult act (巫蠱の術) together with court ladies including AGATA no Unukai no amane, Oshisaka no himemiko and Ishida no himemiko to curse the Emperor Koken and the Emperor Shotoku to shorten their lives in order to put Shikeshimaro on the imperial throne.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。スペースを修正しました。such as→including と修正しました。together を削除しました。life→lives,Throne→imperial throne と修正しました。「巫蠱の術」については確認が取れておりません。
sen.e: It is said that the Imperial Princess Fuwa performed an occult act (巫蠱の術) together with court ladies including AGATA no Unukai no amane, Oshisaka no himemiko and Ishida no himemiko to curse the Emperor Koken and the Emperor Shotoku to shorten their lives in order to put Shikeshimaro on the imperial throne.

sen.j: 天皇の髪の毛を盗んで佐保川の髑髏に入れて、宮中に持参して三度、厭魅したという。
sen.e: She stole Emperor's hair and kept it in a skull in Saho-gawa river, and then brought it to the Imperial Palace and cursed to kill three times.
They stole the Emperor's hair and kept it in a skull in Saho-gawa River, and then brought it to the Imperial Palace and cursed to kill three times.
sen.cmt: She→They,river→River と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: They stole the Emperor's hair and kept it in a skull in Saho-gawa River, and then brought it to the Imperial Palace and cursed to kill three times.

sen.j: 不破内親王は内親王の名を削られ厨眞人厨女（台所の下女）と改名の上で、都から追放され、志計志麻呂は土佐国へ流罪となった。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Fuwa was stripped of her title Imperial Princess and given the name of KURIYA no Mahitokuriyame (kitchen maid servant), deported from Kyoto, and Shikeshimaro was deported to Tosa Province.

The Imperial Princess Fuwa was stripped of her title imperial princess and given the name of KURIYA no Mahitokuriyame (kitchen maid servant), deported from Kyoto, and Shikeshimaro was exiled to Tosa Province.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Imperial Princess→imperial princess,deported→exiled と修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Fuwa was stripped of her title imperial princess and given the name of KURIYA no Mahitokuriyame (kitchen maid servant), deported from Kyoto, and Shikeshimaro was exiled to Tosa Province.

sen.j: 称徳天皇の崩御後の宝亀2年（771年）県犬養姉女らの罪は誣告であったとして、不破内親王は内親王に復して都へ帰った。
sen.e: After Emperor Shotoku died in 771, Imperial Princess Fuwa was given back her title Imperial Princess and returned to Kyoto since the government admitted that the accusation to AGATA no inukai no aneme was false.

After the Emperor Shotoku died in 771, the Imperial Princess Fuwa was given back her title imperial princess and returned to Kyoto since the government admitted that the accusation of AGATA no inukai no aneme and others was false.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Imperial Princess→imperial princess,to→of,スペースを修正しました。and others を補いました。
sen.e: After the Emperor Shotoku died in 771, the Imperial Princess Fuwa was given back her title imperial princess and returned to Kyoto since the government admitted that the accusation of AGATA no inukai no aneme and others was false.

sen.j: 志計志麻呂の記録はなく、土佐で死去したと思われるが、弟とされる川継が入れ替わるように史書に登場するため、両者を同一人物とする説もある。
sen.e: As there is no record of Shikeshimaro kept, it is assumed that he died in Tosa Province, but Kawatsugu, his brother, appeared in the historical book replacing Shikeshimaro, so that some theories claim that the two of them were the same person.

As there is no record of Shikeshimaro found, it is assumed that he died in Tosa Province, but Kawatsugu, supposed to be his brother, appeared in the historical book as if replacing Shikeshimaro, so that some theories claim that the two of them were the same person.
sen.cmt: kept→found と修正しました。supposed to be,as if を補いました。
sen.e: As there is no record of Shikeshimaro found, it is assumed that he died in Tosa Province, but Kawatsugu, supposed to be his brother, appeared in the historical book as if replacing Shikeshimaro, so that some theories claim that the two of them were the same person.

sen.j: 高知県須崎市には志計志麻呂の供養塔がある。
sen.e: There is a memorial tower for Shikeshimaro in Suzaki city, Kochi prefecture.
There is a memorial tower for Shikeshimaro in Susaki City, Kochi Prefecture.
There is a memorial tower for Shikeshimaro in Susaki City, Kochi Prefecture.
